alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 11:49AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, northwestern Philadelphia and northeastern Delaware Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1149 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Conshohocken, or 11 miles northwest of Philadelphia, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Norristown, West Norriton, East Norriton, Conshohocken, Ambler, Plymouth Meeting, Bryn Mawr, Chestnut Hill, Trout Lake, Radnor Township, King Of Prussia, Bridgeport, West Conshohocken, Fort Washington, Blue Bell, Flourtown, Oreland, Wyndmoor and Ardmore. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 326 and 339. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 26. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 336. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Pennsylvania.

area.areaDesc: Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Philadelphia
